channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Senate Probe Uncovers Allegations of Widespread Abuse in ICE Custody
item.description: Led by US senator Jon Ossoff, the investigation cites hundreds of reports since January, including accounts of miscarriages, child neglect, and sexual...

item.title: Meta is shaking up its AI org, again
item.description: On Friday, The Information reported that Meta was preparing to tear down its existing AI org and reorganize it into four new groups. Four days later, ...

item.title: The 50 Best Shows on Hulu Right Now (August 2025)
item.description: Alien: Earth, King of the Hill, and Dope Girls are just a few of the shows you should be watching on Hulu this month.

item.title: Made by Google 2025: How to watch Google debut the Pixel 10, Pixel Watch 4, and more
item.description: Google is hosting its Pixel 10 event next week. Learn how to watch the tech giant reveal its new mobile devices and what else you can expect.

item.title: Appeals court says NLRB structure unconstitutional, in a win for SpaceX
item.description: SpaceX scored a win in a decision from the Fifth Circuit over the labor board's structure.

item.title: PNY’s Overclocked RTX 5070 Ti Is Finally Selling at Retail
item.description: Finding a 50 Series card at retail price is rare, and including Borderlands 4 for free is legendary loot.

item.title: OpenAI Is Poised to Become the Most Valuable Startup Ever. Should It Be?
item.description: The AI startup is chasing a $500 billion valuation, with backers betting it can become the next Apple or Google. There are reasons for skepticism.

item.title: Highly Sensitive Medical Cannabis Patient Data Exposed by Unsecured Database
item.description: Nearly a million records, which appear to be linked to a medical-cannabis-card company in Ohio, included Social Security numbers, government IDs, heal...

item.title: Google pays $30M to settle lawsuit over children’s YouTube data
item.description: Google has agreed to pay $30M to settle a lawsuit over children's data collection, though the company denies wrongdoing.

item.title: Discover how developer tools are shifting fast with Lauri Moore and David Cramer at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.description: From no-code to AI-assisted dev environments, “vibe coding” is changing how early-stage startups build — and who they need to hire. The once-standard ...
